buttons.text: **Include estimates:** Use industry median values when data for a company is not available
**No estimates:** Only display data directly reported to CDP

label: Scope
definition: More information on emissions scopes can be found [here](https://rmi.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/reimagining_greenhouse_gas_disclosures.pdf).

buttons.text: **Scope 1:** Direct emissions from operations
**Scope 2:** Indirect emissions attributed to energy consumption
**Scope 1+2 combined**

label: Sector emission intensity
definition: Emissions intensity is equal to MMTCO₂/annual revenue. Revenue data are sourced from Yahoo Finance.

buttons.text: **Minimum:** Set an emissions intensity equal to the sector minimum for companies that do not volunarily self-report emissions data to CDP.
**Median:** Set emissions intensity to the sector median for companies that do not self-report.
**Maximum:** Set emissions intensity to the sector maximum for companies that do not self-report.

**GDP Constant:** Set the annual growth rate for each company to historical global GDP growth from the World Bank (2018-19). This value is the same for all sectors and industries. <small>Source: [World Bank](https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.MKTP.KD.ZG)</small>
**Revenue by Sector:** Set the annual growth rate for each company to the historical revenue growth rate of each sector in the S&P 500 Index (2018-19). <small>Source: Bloomberg</small>

**Revenue by Industry:** Set the annual growth rate for each company to the historical revenue growth rate of each industry (2015-19). <small>Source: [NYU Stern School of Business](https://pages.stern.nyu.edu/~adamodar/New_Home_Page/datafile/histgr.html)</small>

label: End target
definition: Set the 2050 end targets for the companies. For both "None to Net-zero Target" and "Top 50% to Net-zero Target", companies outside of the specified group are set to their current end targets.

buttons.text: **Current:** Use each company's current self-reported and quantifiable target to its emissions trajectory.
**None to NZT:** Apply a net-zero target to companyies that do not have an existing quantifiable climate target.
**Top 50% None to NZT:** Apply net-zero targets to companies that are in the top half of their sector by market capitalization.

label: Interim target
definition: Set the 2030 interim targets for the companies in this sector.

buttons.text: **Current:** Apply each company's current self-reported and quantifiable interim target to its emissions trajectory.
**None to 50% by 2030:** Apply a target of 50% reduction by 2030 to companies that do not have interim targets. Companies that have quantifiable interim targets are set to those targets.

label: Slowdown
definition: Set the year that companies begin to take action.

buttons.text: **None:** Companies remain on target trajectory across all years.
**2030:** Slow climate action, allowing companies to increase emissions along their baseline until 2030, when they begin reducing emissions.
**2040:** No climate action until 2040.

label: Percentage of targets met
definition: Set the percent of emission reduction targets met by each company. Without specific roadmaps and strategy, companies will be unable to meet 100% of their emission reduction targets. This illustrates what happens to sectoral emissions if companies fail to meet their climate goals.

buttons.text: Zero

label: Targets met with offset
_definition: Set the percent of companies in this sector that meet their voluntary emissions target by using carbon offsets. For example, "50%" results in companies only reducing real emissions by 50% and relying on offsets to account for the other 50% of emissions to reach the climate commitments displayed in the Target Scenario.

buttons.text: **Zero:** Companies meet all goals without offsets.
**25%:** Companies only reduce real emissions by 75% and rely on offsets for the rest.
**50%:** Companies only reduce real emissions by 50% and rely on offsets for the rest.

label: Herd catches up to the frontrunners
definition: Set the future behavior of companies with less ambitious targets than leaders.

buttons.text: **No:** Estimate the impact of herd companies remaining on their existing emissions pathways
**Yes:** Estimate the impact of herd companies further reducing their emissions.
